documents.title: our live coverage has now come to an end for the day :
text: that 's all from the norfolk live team for the day - and for the week .
we 'll leave you with this photo of blue skies over sheringham - let 's hope the fine weather continues over the bank holiday weekend .
whatever you 're doing , have a great time - we 'll be back at 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: the bank holiday weather forecast
text: apart from a few isolated showers , tonight will be mostly dry with clear spells .
temperatures could fall as low as 3c ( 37f ) although they 'll rise by the end of the night .
a largely fine and dry day tomorrow , with sunny spells and just the chance of an isolated shower .
temperatures rising to 14c ( 57f ) - although it could be a little bit warmer in the best of the sunshine .
another dry day on sunday , although cloud will increase from the south west later rain is n't expected until the evening .
as for bank holiday monday it 's still uncertain , but potentially we could have some rain , followed by sunshine and showers , with temperatures hitting 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: investigation after gas pipeline breaks
text: an investigation is underway after one of the bacton gas terminal pipelines broke in two .
the section of pipe on the bed of the north sea has split around 17.5km ( 10 miles ) from shore .
operators of the terminal say it was a low pressure line and not flowing gas when the problem occurred , having been isolated at the end of 2016 .
it happened over a week ago but fisherman say they were n't informed .
one of them , melvin robinson , says they only found out today .

it 's an area that 's heavily fished but because we 've heard nothing about it , it could have been a disaster we could have had vessels damaged and we still do n't know if it 's safe for us to go fish there or not . ''
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: meet your local bobby on a bus
text: we 've had `` bobbies on the beat '' but what about `` bobbies on a bus '' ?
pcsos darren smith and michala benton will be boarding the number 11 konnect bus service weekly , to meet passengers and listen to any concerns they may have .
on tuesday , they 'll be holding a surgery on the bus when it departs from dereham market place at 10:25 .
the route will take them through toftwood , shipdham , watton , saham toney , ashill , holme hale , necton and sporle before arriving in swaffham .

documents.title: profits boost at co-op
text: the region 's biggest independent retailer has seen profits rise after investing heavily in its stores .
the east of england co-op has 120 shops in norfolk , suffolk and essex .
however , the group also saw its pay bill rise after the national living wage was increased .
spokesman doug field says they estimate it will cost them nearly £ 4m over four years .
but we 're an ethical retailer and we 're paying the national living wage regardless of age to all our employees , including the under 25s who comprise 25 % of our workforce . ''

documents.title: power surge hits council
text: norfolk county council and great yarmouth 's town hall are continuing to be hit by phone issues caused by a suspected power surge .
back up phone lines are up and running but there are far fewer than normal .
people are being asked to only contact the authority if it is urgent .
it 's also affecting computers at the millennium library in norwich .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: ndr : road closures
text: here 's the latest information we have on road closures , while work continues on the northern distributor road .
a1151 wroxham road - from tuesday , up to two weeks , a long stretch of this road close to ndr site will be reduced to one lane , controlled by traffic lights .
this is for the diversion of a water main .
salhouse road - temporary traffic lights remain in place at the ndr roundabout construction site - the road will close for up to two weeks from monday , 8 may .
reepham road - remaining closed until friday , 5 may when drayton lane between reepham road and hall lane ( drayton ) will also be reopened .
buxton road - the scheduled closure of buxton road , spixworth , has been put back to monday , 5 june , and reduced from three to two weeks .

documents.title: 35th anniversary of tornado 's arrival at marham
text: this week marks the 35th anniversary of the arrival of the first tornado aircraft at raf marham .
the first tornado squadron to be stationed at the west norfolk base was 617 squadron .
the tornados have been on almost continuous service across the world ever since and are currently supporting operations over the skies of iraq and syria .

documents.title: illegal cigarettes found in norwich raids
text: thousands of illegal cigarettes have been seized in raids across norwich .

trading standards officers , accompanied by police , council and two detection dogs , carried out inspections on six shops yesterday , seizing a total of 13,500 illegal cigarettes and 250g of illegal hand-rolled tobacco from four of the premises .

trading standards spokesman brian chatten says the inspections show there are retailers in the county who 're making smoking more accessible to children by selling illegal tobacco at pocket money prices .
they put the health of young people at even greater risk and are also supporting the organised crime gangs who we know are linked to this criminal activity . ''

documents.title: new monitoring service for expectant mums
text: a new service is being offered to mums-to-be after the norfolk and norwich university hospital ( nnuh ) secured £ 10,000 funding for portable foetal monitors .
three cardiotocography monitors have been purchased and will be used at two bases from which the broadland and castle community midwife teams operate .
if there are any concerns following the monitoring , the women will be asked to come into hospital for further assessment .

documents.title: top crime authors descend on norwich
text: some of the top names in crime fiction are coming to norwich to take part in the fourth noirwich crime writing festival .
val mcdermid , martina cole ( mark billingham , stuart macbride and anthony horowitz headline the festival .
the event , between 14 and 17 september , will cover all forms of crime writing .
the noirwich festial , a collaboration between the university of east anglia and the writers ' centre , takes place at the arts centre , uea and jarrold .
there 'll also be fringe events across the city .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more people holidaying at home
text: more of us are holidaying at home because of the low value of the pound , according to a survey .

brexit is `` very good news '' for the regional tourism industry , explains pete waters of visit norfolk , despite 10 % of tourism businesses in the county saying they 're worried about its impact on staffing levels .

`` a weak pound leads to a double win more people having domestic vacations and overseas visitors able to have more affordable trips however brexit has n't happened yet so we do n't know the long term impact . ''
almost 70 % of businesses saw an increase in turnover last year .
one business that saw an increase in business was wiveton hall .
remember those eyebrows ?
after desmond featured in the four-part `` normal for norfolk '' bbc two series , they had the best season ever .
turnover was up 35 % we estimated 5 % was down to good weather , but 30 % down to the television series it was the best season we 've ever had . ''

documents.title: stars missing two riders for somerset trip
text: king 's lynn stars have been forced to bring in two guest riders for tonight 's premiership speedway trip to somerset rebels .
number one chris holder is ruled out because of his commitments at this weekend 's grand prix in slovenia .
belle vue captain craig cook comes in as a guest .
the stars are also without the injured josh bailey so poole rider james shanes comes into the line-up .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: hockey : player of the year honour for harleston star
text: harleston magpies top scorer maria andrews is celebrating being named the best player in their league this season .
her 17 goals in conference east during the campaign also made maria the division 's top scorer .
andrews , who is due to move to loughborough university for next season , said : `` it 's an amazing feeling to know that all the other players from the other teams in the league voted for you..
i 'm just honoured really . ''
so pleased to see two of our players making the east conference team of the year .
abby gooderham and player of the season @ twitterid
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: darts : wright sees off taylor to progress
text: suffolk darts player peter wright has qualified for the premier league play-offs .
the 47-year-old from mendham beat 16-times world champion phil taylor 7-3 in birmingham last night .
`` it 's amazing where i 've come to , i used to be 5/1 against phil and i was odds-on today , but it 's down to the hard work i 've done , '' he told the pdc .
`` i want to win my last two games and push for that top spot and challenge michael , and then try and win the final at the o2 . ''
author: Brenner Woolley
BBC Radio Suffolk sport

documents.title: canaries told to expect intimidating elland road
text: norwich city make their final away trip of the season this weekend when they go to leeds united .
it 's a huge game for the yorkshire club because a defeat would end any hopes of them finishing in the play-offs .
a draw would mean leeds would be relying on results elsewhere .
the leeds manager garry monk has been linked with the vacant head coach role at norwich city this week .
he 's warned the canaries that his side will want to finish the season on a high in front of their home fans .
`` one of the objectives at the start of the season was to make teams fear coming to elland road and we need to do it one more time , '' .
monk told bbc radio leeds .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: man charged in connection with church lead theft
text: a 20-year-old man from norwich has been charged with attempted theft relating to an incident in coltishall earlier this week .
at around 21:30 on wednesday , officers were called to st john 's church following reports of sus activity .
they found a man on the church roof .
he 's now been charged with theft and being in possession of a bladed article .
another man , in his 30s , and a woman in her 20s , were also arrested but have now been released .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: body of man discovered in property
text: investigations are continuing into the circumstances of the death of a man in norwich .
police were called to a property in normanie tower , on rouen road , at around 21:00 yesterday , following concerns for the safety of a resident .
on arrival , they discovered the body of a man in his 20s .
a post mortem examination is to be carried out to establish the cause of death , but officers do n't believe their are any sus circumstances .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: family lose £ 300,000 in scam
text: people in norfolk are being encouraged to be careful of scam mail after a local family lost £ 300,000 .
the scam said a lottery winner was looking to share their winnings with deserving people .
it then asked for details and money to cover continuing legal costs .
stephen maunder , a community protection office from norfolk trading standards , is calling on people to become `` friends against scams '' .

what you 'll get from that is a little bit of an understanding of what are the main scams , the common scams , how scams work and how they approach you and try to get information from you , and how you can spot somebody who could be becoming a scam victim . ''

documents.title: a mostly dry afternoon ahead
text: most places will remain dry , with some sunny spells .
there 's a chance of a few light showers .
temperatures reaching 12c ( 54f ) .
it 's not looking too bad for the bank holiday weekend - saturday will be mostly dry , with temperatures hitting 13c ( 55f ) .
bright and breezy is the theme for sunday , with the chance of rain later in the day .

text: this evening will be rather cloudy with some rain or drizzle .
increased cloud cover will bring the risk of some showers overnight , but as skies clear later , temperatures will drop to 0c ( 32f ) , giving the risk of frost and icy patches .

documents.title: balls , balls and more balls
text: balls tens of thousands of them - and they 've been arriving by the lorry load ready for the a party with a twist it 's for adults .
if you want to let your inner child out to play , you can find the ball pit at mercy nightclub in norwich .

documents.title: internationally-celebrated artist to exhibit at houghton
text: an exhibition of work by the turner-prize winning landscape artist richard long goes on display this weekend .
long 's new pieces , in the grounds of houghton hall , will use a variety of materials , including local stone and flint , and trees from the estate .
it will accompany one of his other 's sculptures which is on permanent display - full moon circle - which was commissioned for houghton in 2003 .
the show - earth sky - is long 's largest since his retrospective at the tate in 2009 , opens this sunday and will run on selected days until october .

documents.title: new manager 's hopes for nature reserve
text: the new manager of a norfolk nature reserve says he 's overjoyed to be given the job .
will fitch will take over at wheatfen in surlingham from david nobbs , who is retiring after 25 years .
he says he wants the reserve , which was founded by the naturalist ted ellis , to be managed in a more natural way .

i 'm a big believer in eco-system functioning i 'd like to see a few of our missing species return particularly in the woodland white admiral butterflies , silver-washed fritillaries and swallowtails on the fen i 'd love to see their population boom as we bring back their food sources . ''

documents.title: funeral held of youngest of crash trio
text: funeral held of youngest of crash trio

documents.title: history maker to open diss corn hall
text: scole 's history maker duncan slater will cut the ribbon on the long-awaited reopening of diss corn hall next friday .
mr slater , who earlier this month became the first double-leg amputee to complete the marathon des sables ultramarathon , will officially open the building at 11:30am .
author: Diss Express

documents.title: hundreds more 'residents ' to boost village population
text: the east norfolk village of martham is expecting 200 extra `` villagers '' this weekend , as it hosts its annual scarecrow festival .
the two day event will also feature decorated wheelbarrows and bikes , fair rides and a flower festival .
two hundred extra `` villagers '' will boost the population at martham as it hosts its annual scarecrow festival .

documents.title: reserve manager completes his last project
text: the manager of a norfolk nature reserve is retiring , after spending 25 years protecting part of the county 's wetland .
david nobbs has helped restore wheatfen at surlingham back to its 1930s condition , creating a habitat for many rare species .
mr nobbs says he 'll be able to rest after completing his last project , to restore the thatch pond .

`` over 10 years it had been completely overgrown with reed you could n't see any clear water now it 's been cleared and our resident swans have started a nest it 's the focal point of wheatfen when you arrive , '' he said .
the reserve , which was founded by the naturalist ted ellis , is one of the last tidal marshes of the yare valley , and consists of open fen , reed beds and sallow carr .
will fitch has been appointed as mr nobbs 's successor .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: photos : destruction caused by baedeker blitz
text: these photos show the damage caused by the baedeker raids , when the luftwaffe targeted norwich on two april nights 75 years ago .
the first two images show the caleys factory which is now the site of the chapelfield shopping centre .
little remained of the roof of st benedict 's church today the church is surrounded by flats .
st augustine 's school suffered extensive damage during the baedeker blitz and had to remain closed for the duration of the war .
later , a swimming pool was built on the site - that 's now been replaced by shops and housing .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: darts : wright looking to build on a successful weekend
text: suffolk 's peter wright can book his place in the premier league play-offs tonight .
the mendham thrower , who won his second european tour title of the year in germany on sunday , faces phil taylor at the barclaycard arena in birmingham .
world number one michael van gerwen can secure top spot in the standings when he plays both adrian lewis and dave chisnall .
author: Brenner Woolley
BBC Radio Suffolk sport

documents.title: 75 years ago the city came under attack
text: seventy five years ago tonight , the city of norwich came under fire .
over two nights - the 27 and 30 april - the luftwaffe heavily bombed the city for more than 2 hours , starting hundreds of fires and causing damage to thousands of homes .
archivist and historian frank meeres ( tells us that more than 160 people lost their lives in the first of the baedeker raids , and 69 in the second .
it was the largest loss of life in the city in a single incident since the plague .
the raids were in retaliation to the raf 's bombing of two medieval towns and buildings in germany .
in revenge , the german high command selected five cities in england that had been most highly rated in the baedeker guide books .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: motocross bikes escort teen 's coffin to funeral
text: friends and family came to wortham today to say goodbye to billy hines , who died with two friends in a car crash in pulham market earlier this month .
mourners were asked to wear a hint of orange - the 16-year-old 's favourite colour .
his coffin was brought to st mary 's church on the back of a warren lorry - the haulage firm owned by the father of kyle warren , one of the other teenagers who died in the crash .
the silence was broken by friends escorting his coffin on motocross bikes .
billy 's family described him as a fun loving and caring boy , who was very hard working .
his friends told me he was kind , funny and cheeky - and they still ca n't believe he 's gone .
author: Robby West
BBC Look East

documents.title: sex offences teacher in court
text: a teacher at downham market academy has been sent to norwich crown court charged with sexual offences against a teenage boy .
emily tatra , of stafford avenue , norwich , appeared before a district judge at king 's lynn magistrates ' court this morning .
mrs tatra , 27 , entered no plea to two offences against a boy under the age of 17 .
one alleged that when she was in a position of trust at downham market she incited a child into sexual activity in march last year .
the other was that she caused him to look at an image of a person engaging in sexual activity .
she was remanded on bail on condition she did not have any contact with children under 18 .
her case will be heard by norwich crown court on 25 may .
the academy has issued a statement saying that mrs tatra has been suspended from her post .
author: Jill Bennett
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: three arrested in connection with church lead theft
text: three people have been arrested in connection with lead theft , after police were called to a church in coltishall at around 21:30 yesterday .
on arrival at st john the baptist church , in church street , they found a 20-year-old man on its roof .
he was arrested on sus of theft , and being in possession of a bladed article .
a man , in his 30s , and a woman in her 20s , were also arrested in connection with the theft .
all three remain in police custody , for questioning .
anyone with information about lead thefts in their area is asked to contact norfolk police , or crimestoppers .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: call centre jobs under threat
text: more than 180 jobs are under threat at a norwich call centre after the insurance broker swinton announced plans to reshape its business .
a 45-day consultation is underway on proposals which could see work from the rosary road centre transfer to the firm 's head office in manchester .
the company says they 'll relocate staff within the business if possible .
across the country 900 jobs could be lost by the end of the year as swinton reviews 84 of its branches .
a shift towards customers renewing their insurance policies online is said to be at the heart of the overhaul .

documents.title: weather : cool , cloudy and wet
text: we 've now seen the last of the sunny weather for the day the clouds are expecting to thicken , bringing light and patchy rain .
we could seen the odd heavier burst by early evening .
the temperature will reach a high of 10c ( 50f ) .

documents.title: lambert 's dreams did n't come true - luckily
text: norfolk 's robert lambert , who was crowned british u21 speedway champion last night , dreamt the night before the meeting that he came second again .
lambert came second in 2015 and 2016 when he was beaten to the finish line in the final race .
video hear the thoughts of @ twitterid & @ twitterid @ twitterid after finally winning the british under-21 title .
18x you know
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: mental health patient tells of 'disruptive ' experience
text: back now to our story on how no new beds will be created for people in a mental health crisis in norfolk and suffolk .
richard evans from norwich was sent to london as there were no beds available in the local area when he went through a period of severe depression .
he found the whole process extremely disruptive while he was seriously ill .
one evening at about nine at night i suddenly had a care worker come up to me and say 'pack your bags , you 've got 10 minutes to leave .
'a bed space has come up in norwich now.. that 's it , you 're going . ' .
that was very stressful..
if i was in guantanamo bay i would probably get more than 10 minutes notice to sling my hook , '' he said .

the number of out of area '' bed days reported by the norfolk and suffolk nhs foundation trust went up from 28 in april last year ( the equivalent of one patient out of area per day ) to 606 in march this year ( the equivalent of 20 patients sent out of area per day ) .
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: community facilities 'help hospital admission '
text: the norfolk and suffolk nhs foundation trust said it agreed with the bed review because investing in community facilities like a crisis cafe would help with preventing admission to hospital beds in the first place .

it said beds are not the only , nor necessarily the best , solution to supporting someone in a mental health crisis often the best outcome for a patient is achieved when they can remain within their own home , close to the people who care for or support them , with good community-based , mental health support in place . ''
in board papers being discussed at a meeting in ipswich today the trust admits that demand for adult acute beds is a concern '' .
in january 2014 , health managers said that they 'd stop sending people out of area within four months..
the mental health trust now says that wo n't stop happening until 2018 .
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: pictures : funeral procession for car crash teenager
text: mourners followed the coffin of 16-year-old billy hines as it made its way through country lanes to the church of st mary the virgin in wortham .
the teenager was the youngest of three friends who died when the car they were travelling in left the tivetshall road , near pulham market , and crashed into a tree earlier this month .
his parents say billy had many interests , including shooting , motorbikes and cars .

documents.title: bed review 'making finances fit the fact '
text: critics argue the bed review , which has cost £ 58,000 and taken six months to complete , is trying to make the finances fit the facts .
the norfolk and suffolk nhs foundation trust spent £ 4.5m last year placing patients in private hospitals and hospitals outside of norfolk and suffolk , including places like london and brighton .
terence o'shea , from the campaign to protect mental health services in norfolk and suffolk , said the conclusion did n't make sense .
the trust spent £ 740,000 last month alone sending people all round the country as there are n't enough beds .
`` you ca n't spend three quarters of a million pounds in one month because you do n't have enough beds , then say you do have enough beds . ''
he added : people need treatment from the nhs , not platitudes , families and carers can make cups of tea . ''
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: lambert wins british u21 speedway title
text: norfolk 's robert lambert confirmed himself as the best young speedway rider in the uk last night after being crowned british under 21 champion .
the 19-year-old won each of his five heats before seeing off last year 's champion josh bates in the grand final .
despite the season still being young , it 's his second piece of silverware after winning the premiership pairs with chris holder in march .
2017 british under-21 final 1st - robert lambert 2nd - adam ellis 3rd - josh bates 4th - nathan greaves
well done josh , ,great lad seen him at nss for leicester well done to robert and adam also , ,hope to see you again josh , ,be safe lad
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: 'no new beds ' for people in mental health crisis
text: an independent review has found there are enough mental health beds in norfolk and suffolk for people in a crisis .
that 's despite the health watchdog the care quality commission ( cqc ) saying in october they believed there was a shortage .
the review was commissioned by the norfolk and suffolk nhs foundation trust and cqc groups in the area .
it said a `` crisis cafe '' should be set up in norwich instead which would provide support to people whose mental health condition was getting worse..
the cafe is planned to open by december .
the review also said there should be more community `` step down '' beds to help people coming out of a crisis who were not yet ready to return home .
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: funeral for crash death teen
text: the funeral of a teenager who was killed with two friends in a car crash earlier this month will take place this morning .
billy hines , 16 , from wortham near diss , was in a car with dominic o'neill , 18 , and kyle warren , 17 , when their vehicle left the road and hit a tree near pulham market .
his funeral will be held at wortham church at 10:30 , with mourners encouraged to wear orange - a colour billy 's family associate with him .
earlier this week , hundreds of people turned out in harleston for the funeral of kyle warren .
dominic o'neill 's funeral takes place next month in pulham market .

documents.title: norwich mp clive lewis criticised over poll tweet
text: norwich south labour mp clive lewis was asked to correct a tweet featuring a poll said to be wrongly credited to a market research agency .
mr lewis tweeted a poll graphic which put him in the lead at 36 % over his local political rivals and credited the research as being from icm in norwich south , january 2017 .
but today icm director martin boon asked him to withdraw the firm 's name from the tweet , saying the company did not recognise the poll .
mr lewis has since replaced the tweet with an identical chart crediting the figures to `` recent polling analysis '' in his constituency .
a spokeswoman for mr lewis said there was a `` basic problem with the mislabelling of the data '' and that the party had been using analysis of icm data but did not elaborate further .
however , mr lewis later tweeted saying the graph used publicly available constituency-level eu referendum analysis by an `` expert academic '' .

documents.title: bike champion , 18 , wins competition days after heart operation
text: an 18-year-old has won a national bike competition just 12 days after undergoing a five-hour heart operation .
sophie wright , of horsford , clinched first place in the mountain bike national series in berkshire .

doctors carried out the operation at papworth hospital on 11 april after they found the problem - which caused sophie 's heart to race up to 266 beats per minute - was too tricky to fix during initial surgery in january .
`` it was quite nerve-wracking - if they 'd got the operation wrong there could have been a chance i 'd have ended up with a pacemaker which would have ended my cycling career , '' she said .
`` i had to hope everything was ok - papworth is one of the best heart hospitals in the world , '' she added .
sophie finished five minutes ahead of her nearest rival at the weekend and is a rising star in team gb 's cycling team and part of the junior olympic programme .

documents.title: north walsham woman cleared of encouraging driver in hit-and-run
text: a woman has been cleared of encouraging a motorist to drive into a group of people during a hit-and-run ( in north walsham last year .
sammi horner , 35 , of market place , north walsham , was found not guilty today following her trial at norwich crown court .
she had denied encouraging darren blackmore to hit the group of pedestrians , causing one man to be thrown into the air and suffer a broken pelvis in the early hours of 23 july .
she was cleared of encouraging or assisting the commission of an indictable-only offence .
mr blackmore , 43 , formerly of cantley lane , norwich , pleaded guilty in december to causing grievous bodily harm with intent .
he now faces sentencing following the end of ms horner 's trial .

documents.title: uea highest ever ranking 'well deserved ' , says student newspaper editor
text: the editor of uea student newspaper concrete has welcomed the news that the institution has achieved its best ever ranking in a league table .
the university of east anglia has come 12th in the complete university guide , rising up two places from last year .
`` the quality of teaching is brilliant - i feel very lucky to be studying where i am - i think it 's very well deserved , '' said megan baynes .
`` over the last couple of years its reputation has really grown - when i applied to the uea a lot of people thought i was going to study in dubai .
`` i think the quality of the teaching has gone up so the quality of the people applying has gone up . ''
the guide rates 129 universities across 10 categories and also ranks 70 subjects , with uea appearing in the top 10 for nine of the 35 subjects it offers .

documents.title: uea celebrates its best ranking in league table
text: the university of east anglia has been given its highest ever rating in one of the main league tables .
it 's climbed up to 12th place - from 14th - in the complete university guide .
vice-chancellor prof david richardson said such surveys encourage more students to apply .
`` it 's about the wonderful campus we have and that strong partnership between our students and staff , '' he said .

`` it 's also about the wonderful city of norwich and the region of norfolk more widely because we have 15,000 students and we accommodate 5,000 on our campus but 10,000 are living in the city - they are part of the community .
`` in this table we were 25th just five years ago .
they are leaving this university with a high quality experience and very good degrees . ''

documents.title: photos of runaway swan as it hitches police ride
text: photos have been released of the moment a swan caught a ride in a police car after it was captured blocking one of the main routes in norfolk .
the bird caused gridlock after landing and waddling around the a47 at the postwick junction , on the outskirts of norwich , at about 07:00 this morning .
officers were called and eventually caught the swan about 40 minutes later and popped it in their car boot .
it was then released back into the water nearby at thorpe st andrew , a police spokesman said .
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: runaway swan driven away in police patrol car after a47 chaos
text: in scenes reminiscent of police spoof movie hot fuzz , officers had to transport a runaway swan in their patrol car after it caused traffic chaos on the a47 this morning .
long tailbacks were caused on the dual carriageway around the postwick junction , near norwich , after the bird landed on the king 's lynn-bound stretch .
police were called at 07:00 to reports of the swan in the middle of the road - and then set up a rolling roadblock on the opposite side when the bird flew over the traffic barriers .
officers eventually captured it and took it away in their car at 07:40 , a norfok police spokesman said .
it was then safely released into the water at thorpe st andrew .
the wandering wild bird sparked a flurry of tweets from motorists

documents.title: horse dies after spate of abandoned animals
text: a horse has died and two more have been abandoned in the swaffham area in just 10 days - sparking an appeal from an animal charity for information .
the horse ( above ) died shortly after he was spotted wandering the roads around castle acre on 1 april , the world horse welfare said .
another horse was rescued in necton two days later , before an emaciated pony , now called doris , ( below ) was discovered in castle acle the following week .
doris is being treated at the charity 's hall farm rescue and rehoming centre at snetterton , while the other filly is being cared for locally .
world horse welfare field officer , jacko jackson said : `` we are keen to find out who is responsible for these horses and for the appalling acts of abandoning them in this way . ''

documents.title: norwich airport arrest 'not terror-related ' , police say
text: an incident at norwich airport yesterday where a man was arrested and recalled to prison was not being treated as terror-related , police have said .
the intruder , 31 , got into a secure part of the site and attacked one worker with a mug and another with what 's believed to be a piece of glass .
the man then climbed into a parked lorry cab and verbally threatened a member of security staff , before he was arrested .
no-one else is being sought in connection with the early morning incident , police have said .

documents.title: vulnerable people 'used ' by drug dealers
text: a major drug operation in norfolk has found children as young as 14 being used by dealers .
operation gravity has been targeting dealers coming into norfolk from other areas including london .
officers have arrested 175 people since december .
norfolk police found young and vulnerable people were increasingly being used to move and store drugs .
supt dave marshall said : `` we are not arresting people just because they are vulnerable , we 're arresting them because they are committing offences .
`` once we 've dealt with people , we want to prevent them from being vulnerable in the future and help them turn their lives around . ''
author: Janet Harnden
BBC Radio Norfolk

police were alerted at 02:30 and the man was arrested on sus of assault .
he was deemed unfit to be interviewed after a mental health assessment .
he was then returned to hmp norwich .

text: kyle warren 's head teacher , richard cranmer , says today 's funeral service for the 17-year-old was `` extremely touching , very moving and very appropriate for the occasion '' and summed up memories of kyle well .
the teenager was killed alongside two friends , when the car they were travelling in went off the road near pulham market and collided with a tree .
mr cranmer said it 's been a very difficult time for students and staff at the archbishop sancroft high school .
we only have 370 students , so it 's like a big family so when we lose three we lose a big part of our community .
we 've stuck together and based that on looking back at the happy times we had with kyle and with his two friends . ''

documents.title: how to have the perfect pet
text: the dogs trust says more and more people are giving up their pets because they ca n't cope with their bad behaviour , with damage costing owners around £ 350 a year .
when bbc reporter andrew turner returned home recently , he was confronted by this evidence of rufus 's busy day !
so how can you teach your dog new tricks ?
rex makemsom is a dog trainer and behaviourist in dersingham .
he told me that it takes patience , but every dog can be trained one way or another - and can take an average of six weeks .
his springer spaniel charlie is now 10 years old - but when rex got him , he was frightened of his own shadow .
`` now he can dance , do a whole routine you 'd think he was two the way he 's carrying on . ''
the important thing , says rex , is to let the dog know who 's in charge .
reward them for every good behaviour , and ignore the bad you 'll very quickly get a trained dog .
you 'll always get different breeds , some more stubborn than others , but it 's the personality of the dog , you work towards that personality . ''
author: Wally Webb
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: lorry convoy for crash teen 's funeral
text: hundreds of people packed the streets of harleston this morning to remember kyle warren .
the 17-year-old was one of three teenagers who were killed when their car came off the road near pulham market nearly three weeks ago .
a convoy of lorries drove through the south norfolk town , with kyle 's father driving his hgv to his son 's funeral .
kyle 's favourite music played as his coffin was carried inside st john 's church .
kyle died alongside two of his friends - 18-year-old dominic o'neill , from pulham market , and billy hines , 16 , from wortham in suffolk .
billy 's funeral is this thursday , at wortham church .
a funeral service for dominic will be held at pulham market church next tuesday afternoon .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: public inquiry into planning application
text: a public inquiry into house building plans in north norfolk has started today
it 's over a refusal for planning permission for up to 200 homes in sculthorpe , near fakeham .
the developers , amstel group corporation ltd , wanted to build up to 200 homes , a new access road , primary school and play areas .

but in january last year , north norfolk district council refused the application as councillors decided the development would harm the conservation area , and was too far from local services or facilities .
the developers are now challenging the decision .
the hearing , before a planning inspector at the council offices in cromer , is expected to last six days .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foodbank use 'not linked to any one issue '
text: the number of food parcels given out by an independent foodbank in great yarmouth has quadrupled in the last year , and the trustees think it 's directly due to universal credit ( uc ) .
liz townson says the rollout of universal credit means people are not receiving any benefit for a minimum of 42 days , so they 're committed to working with them through that period of time .
`` the rollout was quite slow to start with but we 've now hit the bulge , we 'd hoped it would level out but it 's still going up , it 's on the rise every month . ''
in response , the department for work & pensions ( dwp ) tell us `` the reasons for foodbank use are complex , so it 's misleading to link them to any one issue . ''
employment is the best route out of poverty , and there are now record numbers of people in work .
under universal credit , people are moving into work faster and staying in work longer than under the old system . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foodbank 'struggling ' to meet demand
text: great yarmouth has an independent foodbank - and like those run by the trussell trust , it too has seen an increase in demand for supplies .
in april last year , it handed out 94 parcels .
in december the number had risen to 425 - and so far this april they 've given out 1,700 packs to people in great yarmouth and gorleston
liz townson ( in december ) is one of the trustees , and she told me they ca n't carry on this way .
last week they had a meeting , and will be looking at limiting the number of boxes , otherwise they say they wo n't be able to meet the worst cases .
we 're struggling .

when you think the amount of boxes we 've given out since a year ago has quadrupled , we 're finding it very difficult to get hold of food and finance to make sure people who come to us get looked after properly .
if we did n't have such a brilliant community we 'd be up the swannee . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: adam mudd : judge took into account hacker 's autism
text: the hertfordshire computer hacker adam mudd has been sentenced to two years in a young offenders institute after pleading guilty to computer hacking offences .
judge michael topolski said he took into account the defendant 's diagnosis of autism in his sentencing .
but the judge also drew attention to the `` truly world-wide nature of this kind of criminality '' and said the defendant 's offences had caused `` great and lasting damage '' .
mr topolski added : `` he knew full well he was committing serious crime and in doing so was taking a risk with his liberty . ''
the old bailey heard mudd , 20 , of toms lane , kings langley created the titanium stresser `` malware '' in 2013 , when he was 16 years old , and sold it to cyber criminals across the world .

the programme had 112,000 registered users who were responsible for about 1.7 million `` distributed denial of service '' attacks on websites , including gaming sites such as runescape , minecraft and xbox live .
the court heard there were about 25,000 attacks on runescape and the company which owns it spent £ 6m trying to defend itself .
prosecutors said mudd carried out 594 attacks himself , including one on west herts college , where he was studying computer science .
other attacks including websites belonging to the university of cambridge , uea and university of essex .

documents.title: increasing demand for foodbanks
text: the number of food parcels being handed out in norfolk has risen in the past year .

the trussell trust , which runs foodbanks in king 's lynn , norwich , hunstanton , cromer , thetford and dereham , says it distributed 18,325 three-day packs of emergency food supplies in the last year .
the charity said it was an increase of 9.5 % on the previous year .

spokeswoman jo stevenson says the reasons for the increase varies , but benefit delays and changes account for around 45 % of the referrals , and low-income families almost 26 % - which is similar to national figures .
it 's not acceptable in any society for people to be going hungry and to not be able to put food on their plates .
foodbanks are amazing organisations , with communities and volunteers coming together to help those in crisis feed themselves . ''

documents.title: airport incident 'not terror-related '
text: investigations are continuing into an incident at norwich international airport after two men were assaulted after a man got into a `` secure '' part of the site .
norfolk police were called shortly before 02:30 after an airport worker reported an intruder .
the man entered a hangar , approaching two workers .
one was assaulted with a mug and another with what 's believed to be a piece of broken glass .
the victims suffered minor cuts and bruising , but did n't require medical treatment .
the suspect then entered the cab of a stationary lorry , and verbally threatened a nearby member of security staff .
a 31-year-old man from london has been arrested on sus of assault inflicting actual bodily harm , and is in custody at wymondham police headquarters .
supt dave marshall said the incident with resolved promptly , with officers on scene within eight minutes of the 999 call , and the suspect arrested shortly afterwards .
we are treating this as an isolated incident and we are not looking for anyone else in connection with it .
it 's not currently being treated as a terror-related incident .
there will be visible police patrols around the airport to provide reassurance , however there is no information at this time to suggest there is any threat to the wider public . ''

documents.title: teen computer hacker who attacked gaming websites due to be sentenced
text: the sentencing hearing is due to resume later for a teenager who made about £ 360,000 creating and selling computer hacking software .
adam mudd , now 20 , of kings langley in hertfordshire , has admitted various offences under the computer misuse act .
his software was used to target the websites of games including minecraft , runescape and xbox live .
the old bailey has already heard that he personally attacked the websites of colleges including the university of cambridge , university of east anglia and university of essex .
on friday , judge michael topolski qc said he would not be rushed in determining what mudd 's sentence would be .
the hearing is due to resume at 12:00 in london .

armed officers were called shortly before 02:30 following reports a man had got into a `` secure '' area of the site , assaulted two people in a hangar and verbally threatened a third person .
two victims suffered minor injuries , the third was uninjured .
a short while later a man in his 30s was arrested on sus of assault and remains in police custody for questioning .
the hangar has been sealed off while police investigations continue .
no public areas of the airport have been affected and the airport remains open with flights operating as normal .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: appeal deadline extended for two men facing death penalty
text: two burmese men , who 're facing the death penalty in thailand over the murder of a young woman from hemsby , have had their appeal deadline extended .
zaw lin and wai phyo were found guilty in december 2015 of murdering 23-year-old hannah witheridge and david miller , 24 , from jersey , on a beach on the island of koh tao in september 2014 .
in march , a thai appeal court upheld the death sentences given to the two men .
their last avenue of appeal is to the country 's supreme court .
the men claim dna evidence used to secure their conviction was unsound .

their lawyers say they can still challenge the verdict , but because the defence team claims it is working on such limited resources they need more time to prepare a large amount of technical documents .
they 've now been given until 23 may to file the appeal .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: national stalking awareness week
text: this week is national stalking awareness week , which aims to raise awareness of the effect stalking can have on people .
the behavior includes anything from persistent texting , sending unwanted gifts , to a stalker getting into someone 's garden to rearrange their furniture so as to cause feelings of violation .
this year 's campaign focuses on helping police and support workers recognise the signs of stalking at an early stage .
statistics for norfolk reveal the number of stalking incidents recorded by norfolk police during the 2015/16 financial year were 51 , compared to 42 in 2014/15 .
det supt julie wvendth urges anyone who is being stalked to come forward .
`` we recognise stalking victims can often feel alone and unable to seek help for fear of repercussions or that they will not be taken seriously , '' she said .
`` you should n't feel as though you 're wasting our time or that you 're over reacting . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: traffic calming measures 'really dangerous '
text: there 's concern traffic calming measures in gorleston could be problematic .
the county council has built two pinch points on the high street in advance of a new 20mph limit .
but kevin huggins , from the gorleston traders association , is worried about the pinch point at the north end of the street .
`` it 's really dangerous , '' he said .
`` it 's not well-lit and at night a car going up there and not really paying attention is going to hit the kerbs that stick out . ''
but in a statement , the county council said : `` we always carry out a safety audit on new-build schemes once they are complete .
`` this will happen very shortly and we will take action if this throws up any issues . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: young people 's project call for unwanted motorbikes
text: an organisation which works with young people is on the look out for any unwanted motorbikes .
the st edmunds society in norwich helps young people who struggle in mainstream education by offering them a range of vocational training skills , including motorbike maintenance .
debbie grantham , from the society , says they 're valuable skills .
`` they get an accredited qualification , they learn all about vehicle maintenance , '' she said .
`` we also get people in to teach them about road safety . ''
the mended bikes are sometimes sold and the money reinvested into the project .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: 'elephant ' takes a stroll in the park
text: an elephant was on the loose in chapelfield gardens earlier but fear not , oona is just a puppet .
the life size puppet took a tour of the gardens with children from magdalen gates primary school , all of whom are young carers .
oona was in norwich because she is starring in running wild at the theatre royal .
based on a story by michael morpurgo , the play is about a little girl 's trip to indonesia .
she is riding the elephant when a tsunami hits the country , and she escapes the danger after it charges into the jungle .
oona and all the puppets in the play have been designed by the people behind the war horse play , which won international acclaim , and was also written by morpurgo .

documents.title: two spotted on cctv 'starting fires at school '
text: police say arson was behind a fire at a norwich primary school yesterday afternoon .
the fire at catton grove primary school , at about 15:40 , was started in a bin .
the school said it caused `` considerable damage '' to the enclosed bin storage area , bike shelters and scaffolding .

headmaster tim lawes says police are studying the school 's cctv footage , which shows two individuals on site a few hours before the blaze , lighting small fires before igniting one of the bins containing paper .
`` it is very upsetting because we pride ourselves as a community school and we do n't restrict access to those people who treat the site with respect , '' he said .
`` i 'm hoping we wo n't have to change our policy now . ''
classrooms were not been damaged by the blaze and pupils were not affected .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: woman 's jaw broken in norwich
text: a man 's been arrested on sus of assault after a woman in norwich had her jaw broken during a night out .
police say it happened in adelaide street in the early hours of saturday , after two men and two women got into an altercation .
the man , in his 30s and from the norwich area , remains in custody .
charley steven ( was on a night out with her sister .
author: Janet Harnden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: norfolk gets new music festival
text: a free music festival has been announced for fakenham .
active fakenham is hosting the event in the market place on saturday 19 august .
it will run from 12:00 to 20:00 , with the music continuing in several venues around town until late .
richard crook , of active fakenham , said : `` the focus will be on local talent .
we hope to have a beer tent , straw bales , cream teas , stalls , rides and more in the market place .
`` we hope to be able to showcase some really good music and offer some free entertainment to locals and visitors . ''
the organisers say there will be a series of smaller events over the next few months in the lead up to the festival .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: norfolk cyclists named in revised great britain squad
text: norfolk duo victoria williamson and sophie wright have been included in the new british cycling squad .
the governing body had been forced to reduce the number of athletes in their programme after losing some funding from uk sport .
williamson remains part of the women 's track sprint squad alongside becky james and katie marchant .
she is still battling back from a crash last year which left her with a broken back , neck and pelvis .
wright , 17 , from horsford , is one of just two riders called up for the girls mountain bike olympic junior academy .
she was back competing at the weekend , just 12 days after having heart surgery .
british cycling have named the revised great britain cycling team squad following a review :

documents.title: great yarmouth and king 's lynn seen as growth areas
text: the shopping report commissioned by north norfolk district council was set up to try and find out how best to support the area 's retail industry .
changes in habits and the rise of online shopping has affected north norfolk 's market towns , the report says .
it found that most people went to norwich to shop , with great yarmouth ( and king 's lynn being a `` significant draw '' .
the recommendation is for these two towns to be the focus of any larger scale development .

holt , sheringham , hoveton ( with wroxham ) , stalham and wells-next-the-sea were seen as second tier smaller centres , each providing for convenience food shopping , `` lower order day-to-day comparison shopping facilities and other services '' .

the report said expansion in these areas was limited and much needed , but diversification through `` the promotion of the evening economy , leisure and entertainment and more focus on service sector and convenient service '' would help them prosper .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: shopping report finds a fifth of shops empty in north walsham
text: almost a fifth of shops in one market town in norfolk are empty , a report has found .
north norfolk district council commissioned the analysis to find out what 's happening to the retail economy .
it found north walsham has 18 % of its stores empty and that a cinema would boost the town .
it also highlighted the need for a budget supermarket in holt and investment in fakenham , so fewer shoppers would go to larger centres like norwich or king 's lynn .
local greengrocer nigel benbow has a shop in both holt and fakenham and says cheaper rates would help , so would free car parking .
`` it 's got really bad , '' he said .
`` we have to compete with dereham and they have free car parking and we do n't but we could have . ''

documents.title: pritchard grateful to canaries caretaker manager
text: norwich city 's alex pritchard says supporters are finally seeing the best of him thanks to caretaker manager alan irvine .
the former tottenham attacker started just nine league games under former boss alex neil after joining city last summer .
he has started all eight matches since irvine took charge and was instrumental in friday 's 2-0 win over premier league-bound brighton .
pritchard told me : `` i owe it to him ( irvine ) because he 's trusted in me .
he 's been good for me .
`` before i played a few games , i played really well and whatever happened happened .
now al 's given me the opportunity and i 'm grateful to him . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: king 's lynn town manager sets out summer plans
text: ian culverhouse admits he 's pleased that king 's lynn town 's league season is over .
the linnets finished 13th in the southern premier after an eventful season which saw culverhouse replace long serving manager gary setchell in february .
they finished the campaign with a 3-1 win over chesham united at the walks on saturday .
the former norwich city defender and coach told us : `` i 'm looking forward to the summer .
we 've got to change a lot of people 's mentality about the place .
`` it 's about getting the right characters in and this place could be rocking , it really could . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: paraglider airlifted in dramatic rescue
text: a paraglider has been airlifted to hospital after dramatic scenes on the north norfolk coast .
the norfolk accident rescue service ( nars ) was called to weybourne on saturday evening before 17:00 .
critical care paramedic ryan warwick was first on the scene where he found a paraglider seriously injured at the bottom of the cliffs .
he had suffered severe leg injuries and was sedated at the scene and given pain relief .
the coastguard helicopters were scrambled and the man was airlifted to the norfolk and norwich hospital where he is said to be in a serious but stable condition .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: stab victim remains in 'serious condition '
text: a man remains in a serious condition in hospital following a stabbing in chelmsford .
the 38-year-old victim - from norwich - was also hit over the head during the attack , which happened in the early hours of yesterday .
police say a number of people were in the queensland crescent area before they were called out at about 02:25 , but had left before officers arrived and they want to hear from them .

documents.title: planters pride at being norfolk top dogs
text: norwich united are celebrating a successful first season of ryman league football .
they finished ninth in the table after playing at that level for the first time ever..
the planters did better than norfolk rivals dereham town and wroxham who finished 18th and 23rd in the division .
the yachstmen were relegated .
united finished their league season by losing 2-1 at haringey borough at the weekend .
manager steve eastaugh told us : `` we 've been really pleased with our performance this season .
the boys have had to learn very quickly , a lot of them have been playing at this level for the very first time . ''
all the best to norwich united safe journey @ twitterid
